text: You could try `{% raw %} {{ Context.Environment }} {% endraw %}`

I’m having issues with redirects done in Settings (e.g. from www. to non-www) that causes double 301 redirects before status 200.


<http://www.domain.com> (status 301) -> <https://www.domain.com> (status 301) -> <https://domain.com> (Status 200 OK).


Does anyone know if there is a solution to skipping the extra 301 redirect?

Hi guys. Question, since I am gonna start my first HubSpot project on my job really soon. I absolutely “hate” the whole developer experience so I have two questions.

Is it actually possible to use React and have the same functionalities like when developing everything in HubSpot? So the drag n drop and modules etc?

Are there any good resources for setting up the whole local dev environment to make things easier? Or any online courses?
why do you hate it?

Since I am used to do custom projects with React and everything is so much easier and cleaner to setup. Now you are basically gonna develop back and forth between your local tools and the HubSpot website..
It’s so much slower to develop like this compared to other custom projects.
They have ready connectors with some ESP available. So assuming should be possible to setup custom SMTP as well.
Thanks Joe! I'll try that.

anybody else notice the HubSpot CDN a little slow lately? getting poor LCP scores on some pages right now even with no images above the fold or render blocking JS which makes me thinks is actually related to server performance more than page code

I'm having an issue where the CSS from some modules isn't loading and I'm seeing this error when I try to view the module in the editor `[missing "en-us.app.layoutStyles.editStyles-cleanLines-module" translation]`
anybody know what's up with that? happening to anybody else?
if I add a fresh version of the same module it starts showing up again
Is there a way in HubSpot to limit the number of emails being sent per minute? When we bulk sent an email to a list of contacts, Microsoft flagged the email as spam.
It looks like an old module is/was missing the label in its `meta.json`
I'm going to try to add it in and hope that nothing explodes

There’s no built in throttling option unfortunately.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/BulkMail-Staggered-email-delivery-for-corporations/idi-p/28809>
that's probably not it but it feels related

We currently have a SaaS application that allows our clients to use their HubSpot API token to connect their account to our service.

We are planning to migrate to the new  “Private Apps”.  Will each of our clients have to set up a private app from within their own HubSpot account and provide us with the token to connect to our service?

From the documentation it appears this is not a one time thing we do on our end and setup a private app that then allows any HubSpot account to use it, it looks more like each HubSpot account that wants to connect to our service must setup a private app. Do I have that correct?

If you go the private app route, then yes, each client will need to create an app so they can hand your their access token (this is very similar to today with API keys where the customer has to activiate first, with the added step of selecting scopes)

If you are looking for an option where the end customer doesn't need to take manual action then a public app might be for you.  It's worth noting that a public app does not mean it's listed in our marketplace or anything like that. It does mean that you need to support the OAuth 2.0 flow and refresh tokens every 30 minutes.  You can set up a public app from a developer account
No, I'm not.
